* [[KnoppMyth]] is a [[bootCD]] derivative of [[Knoppix]]. Its MythTV frontend can be run from the CD. An entire installation to the hard disk can take place in minutes.
* [[KnoppMyth]] is a [[bootCD]] derivative of [[Knoppix]]. Its MythTV frontend can be run from the CD. An entire installation to the hard disk can take place in minutes.
* [[Mythbuntu]] combines [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] distributions with MythTV. The Ubuntu community has built [http://help.ubuntu.com/community/MythTV extensive resources] for installing, configuring and troubleshooting MythTV.
* [[Mythbuntu]] combines [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] distributions with MythTV. The Ubuntu community has built [http://help.ubuntu.com/community/MythTV extensive resources] for installing, configuring and troubleshooting MythTV.

* [[Mythdora]] is a Red Hat [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] distribution with MythTV.

* [[Mythdora]] is a Red Hat [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] distribution with MythTV.
* [http://www.imedialinux.com/imedia_mythtv/ iMedia MythTV Linux] distribution is a showcase of the larger iMedia embedded Linux distribution featuring an easy way to install MythTV and turning your system into a personal video recorder.
* [http://www.imedialinux.com/imedia_mythtv/ iMedia MythTV Linux] distribution is a showcase of the larger iMedia embedded Linux distribution featuring an easy way to install MythTV and turning your system into a personal video recorder.
* [http://minimyth.org/ MiniMyth] is a small Linux distribution that turns a diskless computer into a MythTV frontend.
* [http://minimyth.org/ MiniMyth] is a small Linux distribution that turns a diskless computer into a MythTV frontend.
